meanings.definition: An unintentional failure to notice or do something.
meanings.sent1: Due to his oversight, he forgot to submit the report on time.
meanings.sent2: The oversight of the error led to a delay in the project.
meanings.sent3: Her oversight of the cake in the oven resulted in a burnt dessert.
meanings.sent4: The oversight of the leaky faucet caused a flood in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The oversight of the open window allowed the cold air to enter the room.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's oversight ensured that all students followed the safety rules.
meanings.sent2: The manager's oversight of the team's progress was meticulous.
meanings.sent3: The cat's oversight of the mouse's movements was comical.
meanings.sent4: The eagle's oversight of the field was sharp and vigilant.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard's oversight of the pool prevented any accidents.
